item.title: Create Windows VMs in Azure with Terraform
item.description: With Terraform you can easily create new VMs in an existing Azure environment in a couple of minutes. For example, when I want to test an application, I create a new VM and install the application. When I finish testing I remove the VM with a single command. The VM creation only takes a couple of minutes. In this example, an Azure VM is created using existing Azure resources (Resource Group, VNet, and Subnet) with the following settings:
